body.p: Delaware County, Pennsylvania, native. Graduate of the United States Military Academy at West Point, New York, in 1851. Appointed assistant instructor of infantry tactics at West Point in 1857 and again in 1859. Chief Purchasing Commissary at St. Louis. Served as Assistant Adjutant General of the Department of the West with the rank of captain. In the fall of 1861, Commissioned Colonel of the 9th Missouri Volunteers. Resigned his volunteer commission on March 12, 1862. Served as Assistant Adjutant General of the Department of Mississippi in 1862. Appointed to the Adjutant General's Department in April 1865.
